column1: At that moment the queen came out through the palace door
column2: and the prince was so dazzled by her beauty
column3: that only for the golden bracelet he wore upon his right arm
column4: under the sleeve of his silken tunic
column5: he might almost have forgotten the Princess Ailinn. This bracelet was made by the dwarfs who dwell in the heart of the Scandinavian Mountains
column6: and was sent with other costly presents by the King of Scandinavia to the King of Erin
column7: and he gave it to the princess
column8: and it was the virtue of this bracelet
column9: that whoever was wearing it could not forget the person who gave it to him
column10: and it could never be loosened from the arm by any art or magic spell; but if the wearer
column12: liked anyone better than the person who gave it to him
column13: that very moment the bracelet fell off from the arm and could never again be fastened on. And when the princess promised her hand in marriage to the Prince Cuglas
column14: she closed the bracelet on his arm.
